title: Love Changes
features: A man finds a second chance at love after losing his wife and child, hoping for a better future. His new wife is keeping her past hidden from him, however, her bad habits surface when she becomes pregnant. She had been harboring a secret for years and by not telling her husband the truth she puts both of their lives at risk. Will a near loss of everything be what it finally takes for her to open up and take responsibility for her actions or will it truly be the end?
The way the characters have been constructed and written makes them easy to empathize with and even hate at times. It's wonderfully created and very enjoyable, a definite recommendation.

A very well-written book. I recommend it as a sort of lesson in life moment or I should say moments. Rereading is recommended with this book. Really feel it.Love changes by Marsha Casper Cook draws the reader in from the very first page and keeps them until the last word.
description: This was the first book I did from one of my screenplays. I loved writing this book because it was a labor of love. I volunteered at a community center for challenged children to be able to understand why Elaine Lewis, the main character of this book, had a secret that she refused to discuss or share with her husband or best friend.  This is a stand alone book but it has a very interesting story and the appeal is broad. Elaine is a woman that anyone can identify with because almost everyone has private feelings and parts of their life that they don't feel comfortable sharing.

Marsha Casper Cook is the author of six published books and 11 feature-length screenplays. Her published works include "Love Changes," a romantic novel about a family in crisis, and "To Lfe," a non-fiction biography about surviving the Holocaust. She has also written four children's books for young children, including the short stories "Snack Attack" and "The Magical Leaping Lizard Potion" and the poetry collection "The Busy Bus" and "No Shoes No Clues."She has also published a book version of her romantic-comedy screenplay, "It's Never Too Late." Her latest and first Romantic Series is finished 'The Virginia Templeton Stories". She is also now a member of the RWA and is writing a new Novel "Prince Charming" which is scheduled to be out January 2014. Wanting to help new writers reach their goals, Marsha founded the literary agency Marcus Bryan & Associates in 1996, and achieved signatory status from the Writers Guild of America (WGA) within two years. Since early 2010, Marsha has hosted radio shows on Blog Talk Radio. She recently has joined with Host V.S, Grenier as the other half of World Of Ink Network Blog Talk Radio. Her show "A Good Story Is A Good Story" is about writing. Visit her web sites and Blogs at: michiganavenuemedia.com
